title: Are using custom downloadable skins against the rules ?
body: Ive seen a couple different streamers use custom skins (trick2g more than once) and was just wondering if i decided to to use one of these custom skins would i get get banned for third party software ?

replies.body:
There are a lot of different programs that allow you to use custom skins in-game that only you can see.  The best piece of advice I can offer is to NOT use these types of programs.  As a general rule of thumb, anything that modifies the game experience from Champion Select all the way to the End of Game Stats screen is something that can be punished for.  

I hope this helps!  Let me know if you have any other questions!

Why is Trick2g allowed to do that then on stream o_o

It's not that it is ALWAYS ban worthy, it's something that CAN get you banned. For Trick, this risk may be worth it. He makes a living streaming. Customs skins may literally make him money. He has multiple 30s. Losing an account wouldn't be that big of a deal to him. But for the average player, who may have thousands of hours on their only account, the risk of losing it for just a custom skin is probably not worth it.

The main reason they advise against it is there's no way of knowing if something besides the skin is affecting play. There could be some hidden piece of code that violates the terms of agreement, even if the only noticeable in game affect is the custom skin. They would rather you not take your chances of being suspended or banned for something you literally did not know about.

Hello dArtagnan!

I really want to know is there any app for changing in game VO (in my case I want Japanese VO) that is safe to use? I heard about LVOC. Could you tell me if this one is safe to use?

I can confirm that changing VO is not something that you will be punished or banned for.  However, this can seriously corrupt your installation so we do not recommend doing so.  If you do use a 3rd party program (which I can't recommend one), then you do so at your own risk and you may need to re-install!
So are you saying that anything that gives a team an advantage is prohibited, but if it is a visual skin that just changes the appearance its ok?
can i use a custom skin if it just changes the texture not anything else

The general rule of thumb is that anything that affects other players in game, ie. Scripting, hacks, anything that gives you an unfair advantage. Is considered cheating. Everything that doesn't do that is ok, though keep in mind that if there is an update that makes the 3rd party app do one of those things, you will be treated as if you had gotten it with the intent to cheat.
